Docs.summary: Static library support version of the framework's .

remarks.para: Static library support version of the framework's . Used to write apps that run on platforms prior to Android 3.0. When running on Android 3.0 or above, this implementation is still used; it does not try to switch to the framework's implementation. See the framework SDK documentation for a class overview.

Docs.param: Optional identifier of the container this fragment is to be placed in. If 0, it will not be placed in a container.
The fragment to be added. This fragment must not already be added to the activity.
Optional tag name for the fragment, to later retrieve the fragment with .
Docs.summary: Add a fragment to the activity state.

remarks.para: Add a fragment to the activity state. This fragment may optionally also have its view (if returns non-null) into a container view of the activity.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Support.V4.App.FragmentTransaction AddToBackStack(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: An optional name for this back stack state, or null.
Docs.summary: Add this transaction to the back stack.

remarks.para: Add this transaction to the back stack. This means that the transaction will be remembered after it is committed, and will reverse its operation when later popped off the stack.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Support.V4.App.FragmentTransaction Attach(class Android.Support.V4.App.Fragment fragment) cil managed

Docs.summary: Re-attach a fragment after it had previously been deatched from the UI with .

remarks.para: Re-attach a fragment after it had previously been deatched from the UI with . This causes its view hierarchy to be re-created, attached to the UI, and displayed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 Commit() cil managed

Docs.summary: Schedules a commit of this transaction.

remarks.para: Schedules a commit of this transaction. The commit does not happen immediately; it will be scheduled as work on the main thread to be done the next time that thread is ready.

A transaction can only be committed with this method prior to its containing activity saving its state. If the commit is attempted after that point, an exception will be thrown. This is because the state after the commit can be lost if the activity needs to be restored from its state. See for situations where it may be okay to lose the commit.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 CommitAllowingStateLoss() cil managed

Docs.summary: Like but allows the commit to be executed after an activity's state is saved.

remarks.para: Like but allows the commit to be executed after an activity's state is saved. This is dangerous because the commit can be lost if the activity needs to later be restored from its state, so this should only be used for cases where it is okay for the UI state to change unexpectedly on the user.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Support.V4.App.FragmentTransaction Detach(class Android.Support.V4.App.Fragment fragment) cil managed

Docs.summary: Detach the given fragment from the UI.

remarks.para: Detach the given fragment from the UI. This is the same state as when it is put on the back stack: the fragment is removed from the UI, however its state is still being actively managed by the fragment manager. When going into this state its view hierarchy is destroyed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Support.V4.App.FragmentTransaction DisallowAddToBackStack() cil managed

Docs.summary: Disallow calls to .

remarks.para: Disallow calls to . Any future calls to addToBackStack will throw . If addToBackStack has already been called, this method will throw IllegalStateException.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Support.V4.App.FragmentTransaction Hide(class Android.Support.V4.App.Fragment fragment) cil managed

Docs.summary: Hides an existing fragment.

remarks.para: Hides an existing fragment. This is only relevant for fragments whose views have been added to a container, as this will cause the view to be hidden.

Docs.summary: Returns true if this FragmentTransaction is allowed to be added to the back stack.

remarks.para: Returns true if this FragmentTransaction is allowed to be added to the back stack. If this method would return false, will throw .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Support.V4.App.FragmentTransaction Remove(class Android.Support.V4.App.Fragment fragment) cil managed

Docs.summary: Remove an existing fragment.

remarks.para: Remove an existing fragment. If it was added to a container, its view is also removed from that container.

Docs.param: Identifier of the container whose fragment(s) are to be replaced.
The new fragment to place in the container.
Optional tag name for the fragment, to later retrieve the fragment with .
Docs.summary: Replace an existing fragment that was added to a container.

remarks.para: Replace an existing fragment that was added to a container. This is essentially the same as calling for all currently added fragments that were added with the same containerViewId and then with the same arguments given here.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Android.Support.V4.App.FragmentTransaction SetCustomAnimations (int enter, int exit);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Support.V4.App.FragmentTransaction SetCustomAnimations(int32 enter, int32 exit) cil managed

Docs.summary: Set specific animation resources to run for the fragments that are entering and exiting in this transaction.

remarks.para: Set specific animation resources to run for the fragments that are entering and exiting in this transaction. These animations will not be played when popping the back stack.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Android.Support.V4.App.FragmentTransaction SetCustomAnimations (int enter, int exit, int popEnter, int popExit);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Support.V4.App.FragmentTransaction SetCustomAnimations(int32 enter, int32 exit, int32 popEnter, int32 popExit) cil managed

Docs.summary: Set specific animation resources to run for the fragments that are entering and exiting in this transaction.

remarks.para: Set specific animation resources to run for the fragments that are entering and exiting in this transaction. The popEnter and popExit animations will be played for enter/exit operations specifically when popping the back stack.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Support.V4.App.FragmentTransaction Show(class Android.Support.V4.App.Fragment fragment) cil managed

Docs.summary: Shows a previously hidden fragment.

remarks.para: Shows a previously hidden fragment. This is only relevant for fragments whose views have been added to a container, as this will cause the view to be shown.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

Docs.summary: Bit mask that is set for all enter transitions.

remarks.para: Bit mask that is set for all enter transitions.

Docs.summary: Bit mask that is set for all exit transitions.

remarks.para: Bit mask that is set for all exit transitions.

Docs.summary: Fragment is being removed from the stack

remarks.para: Fragment is being removed from the stack

Docs.summary: Fragment should simply fade in or out; that is, no strong navigation associated with it except that it is appearing or disappearing for some reason.

remarks.para: Fragment should simply fade in or out; that is, no strong navigation associated with it except that it is appearing or disappearing for some reason.

Docs.summary: Fragment is being added onto the stack

remarks.para: Fragment is being added onto the stack

Docs.summary: No animation for transition.

remarks.para: No animation for transition.

Docs.summary: Not set up for a transition.

remarks.para: Not set up for a transition.
